content:
In python using pygame when I use this

captured = board.squares[released\_row][released\_col].has\_piece()
 if captured == True:
 print (board.squares[released\_row][released\_col].piece)

it prints for example...

""

how can I use that information - the fact that my piece is a Pawn, in order to create a new condition.

The condition that I want to create is, if the piece that was captured is for example a Pawn do something...
